description: Event is a report of an event somewhere in the cluster. It generally denotes some state change in the system.

action.description: What action was taken/failed regarding to the object. It is machine-readable.

apiVersion.description: The version of the schema for the representation of the object.

deprecatedCount.description: The deprecated field assuring backward compatibility with core.v1 Event type.

deprecatedFirstTimestamp.description: The deprecated field assuring backward compatibility with core.v1 Event type.

deprecatedLastTimestamp.description: The deprecated field assuring backward compatibility with core.v1 Event type.

deprecatedSource.description: The deprecated field assuring backward compatibility with core.v1 Event type.

eventTime.description: The time when this Event was first observed. It is required.

kind.description: A string value representing the REST resource this object represents.

note.description: note is a human-readable description of the status of this operation. Maximal length of the note is 1kB, but libraries should be prepared to handle values up to 64kB.

reason.description: Why the action was taken. It is human-readable. This field can have at most 128 characters.

regarding.description: The object this Event is about. In most cases it's an object reporting controller implements, e.g. ReplicaSetController implements ReplicaSets and this event is emitted because it acts on some changes in a ReplicaSet object.

related.description: Optional secondary object for more complex actions. E.g. when regarding object triggers a creation or deletion of related object.

reportingController.description: The name of the controller that emitted this Event, e.g. `kubernetes.io/kubelet`. This field cannot be empty for new Events.

reportingInstance.description: The ID of the controller instance, e.g. `kubelet-xyzf`. This field cannot be empty for new Events and it can have at most 128 characters.

series.description: Data about the Event series this event represents or nil if it's a singleton Event.

type.description: The type of this event (`Normal`, `Warning`), new types could be added in the future. It is machine-readable.
